data.title: Activision CEO Bobby Kotick will leave Coca-Cola's board ahead of Microsoft deal close
data.description: Activision agreed in January to be bought by Microsoft in a deal worth almost $69 billion.

data.title: The video game world starts moving to cut off Russia amid outcry over Ukraine war
data.description: Ukraine has called on Microsoft and Sony to block all Russian and Belarusian accounts and cancel gaming events in the two countries.

data.title: Microsoft halts all new product and service sales in Russia
data.description: Microsoft said it's also stopping many aspects of its business in compliance with government sanctions rules.

data.author: Laura Benitez
data.title: Wall Street Is Already Pouncing on Russia’s Cheap Corporate Debt

data.author: Angus Whitley
data.title: Toyota and Honda Join Growing Corporate Retreat From Russia
data.description: Toyota and Honda Join Growing Corporate Retreat From Russia

data.title: Russian-backed investment fund tied to influential U.S. corporate consulting firm
data.description: A private equity fund backed by Russian oligarchs, who have been sanctioned by the European Union, has ties to a powerful U.S. consulting firm.

data.title: Senate Democrats aim to link inflation with corporations in new messaging strategy
data.description: A woman behind the counter at the McDonald's in southwest Ohio showed Rep. Tim Ryan the math she was trying to work out last week: filling up her tank would be $20 cheaper in West Virginia, but would that cost less than the gas she'd use on the drive there and back? And what about her shifts, or taking care of her three kids?

data.author: Dina Bass
data.title: Microsoft Says Son of CEO Satya Nadella Has Died
data.description: Microsoft Says Son of CEO Satya Nadella Has Died

data.title: Phil Mickelson is losing corporate relationships over his Saudi remarks
data.description: Already out two corporate endorsements, Phil Mickelson and his foundation were removed from the PGA Tour event in the California desert Saturday.
